meanings.definition: The quality or state of being contrary.
meanings.sent1: Her contrariness often led to disagreements with her friends.
meanings.sent2: His contrariness made it difficult to reach a compromise.
meanings.sent3: The cat's contrariness in refusing to eat its favorite treat was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The contrariness of the weather, switching from sunny to rainy in minutes, was unpredictable.
meanings.sent5: The child's contrariness in wanting to wear shorts in the snow was quite stubborn.

meanings.definition: A contrary or opposite quality or character.
meanings.sent1: The sweetness of her smile was a stark contrast to the contrariness of her words.
meanings.sent2: His kindness was a welcome change from the contrariness of his boss.
meanings.sent3: The contrariness of the puzzle, with pieces that fit where they shouldn't, was puzzling.
meanings.sent4: The contrariness of the river, flowing upstream, was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The contrariness of the cat, purring while scratching, was confusing to the children.

meanings.definition: The tendency to oppose or resist.
meanings.sent1: His contrariness towards new ideas often hindered progress in the team.
meanings.sent2: The contrariness of the old dog, refusing to go for a walk, was frustrating.
meanings.sent3: The contrariness of the alarm clock, always going off at the wrong time, was annoying.
meanings.sent4: The contrariness of the waves, pushing against the shore, was relentless.
meanings.sent5: The contrariness of the politician, disagreeing with every proposal, was exhausting.
